segment.source: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition
segment.target: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition

segment.source: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition
segment.target: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition

segment.source: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition
segment.target: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition

segment.source: After you have finished running the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard and created the recovery image, you can extract the boot.wim file from the ISO image file and deploy it as a recovery partition in a Windows 7 image.
segment.target: After you have finished running the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard and created the recovery image, you can extract the boot.wim file from the ISO image file and deploy it as a recovery partition in a Windows 7 image.

segment.source: To deploy DaRT in the recovery partition of a Windows 7 image
segment.target: To deploy DaRT in the recovery partition of a Windows 7 image

segment.source: Create a target partition in your Windows 7 image that is equal to or greater than the size of the ISO image file that you created by using the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard.
segment.target: Create a target partition in your Windows 7 image that is equal to or greater than the size of the ISO image file that you created by using the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard.

segment.source: The minimum size required for a DaRT partition is approximately 300MB.
segment.target: The minimum size required for a DaRT partition is approximately 300MB.

segment.source: However, we recommend 450MB to accommodate for the remote connection functionality in DaRT.
segment.target: However, we recommend 450MB to accommodate for the remote connection functionality in DaRT.

segment.source: Extract the boot.wim file from the DaRT ISO image file.
segment.target: Extract the boot.wim file from the DaRT ISO image file.

segment.source: Mount the ISO image file that you created in the Create Startup Image dialog box by using your company’s preferred method of mounting an image.
segment.target: Mount the ISO image file that you created in the Create Startup Image dialog box by using your company’s preferred method of mounting an image.

segment.source: Open the ISO image file and copy the boot.wim file from the sources folder in the mounted image to a location on your computer or on an external drive.
segment.target: Open the ISO image file and copy the boot.wim file from the sources folder in the mounted image to a location on your computer or on an external drive.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you burned a CD or DVD of the recovery image, you can open the files on the CD or DVD and copy the boot.wim file from the sources folder.
segment.target: If you burned a CD or DVD of the recovery image, you can open the files on the CD or DVD and copy the boot.wim file from the sources folder.

segment.source: This lets you skip the need to mount the image.
segment.target: This lets you skip the need to mount the image.

segment.source: Use the boot.wim file to create a bootable recovery partition by using your company’s standard method for creating a custom Windows RE image.
segment.target: Use the boot.wim file to create a bootable recovery partition by using your company’s standard method for creating a custom Windows RE image.

segment.source: For more information about how to create or customize a recovery partition, see Customizing the Windows RE Experience.
segment.target: For more information about how to create or customize a recovery partition, see Customizing the Windows RE Experience.

segment.source: Replace the target partition in your Windows 7 image with the recovery partition.
segment.target: Replace the target partition in your Windows 7 image with the recovery partition.

segment.source: After your Windows 7 image is ready, distribute the image to computers in your enterprise by using your company’s standard image deployment process.
segment.target: After your Windows 7 image is ready, distribute the image to computers in your enterprise by using your company’s standard image deployment process.

segment.source: For more information about how to create a Windows 7 image, see Building a Standard Image of Windows 7: Step-by-Step Guide.
segment.target: For more information about how to create a Windows 7 image, see Building a Standard Image of Windows 7: Step-by-Step Guide.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy a recovery solution to reinstall the factory image in the event of a system failure, see Deploy a System Recovery Image.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy a recovery solution to reinstall the factory image in the event of a system failure, see Deploy a System Recovery Image.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Deploying the DaRT 7.0 Recovery Image
